VII.ii.1.A.3.d
.
Continued Entitlement During a Summer Session
Entitlement to benefits as or for a school child continues during a summer session of school, regardless of whether or not the child attends classes during the summer session, as long as the session does not extend beyond a period of time commonly accepted as standard.
Note
:  This policy applies even if
the school operates on a trimester basis, and
enrollment is deferred for the summer trimester, with entrance in the next regular school session.
Example
:
Scenario
:
VA removed a child from a Veteran’s award effective June 1, 2023, because the child stopped attending school in May of the same year.
On August 17, 2023, VA received a
VA Form 21-674
from the Veteran that indicates the same child will resume her school attendance on August 24, 2023.
Result
:  Add the child back onto the award effective June 1, 2023, because she was enrolled in the next regular school session after the summer break.
title: M21-1, Part VII, Subpart ii, Chapter 1, Section A - Benefit Entitlement for School Children
